page.title: 01Ben Cruachan: Beinn Cruachan
page.content: Geology - in the main Granite. Weather - average rainfall 2921mm per year and prevailing SW winds. Land use in lower regions rough grazing, rock outcrops impede this. Peaks in the area - Beinn Cruachan (1126m) and Stob Dearg (Taymuilt Peak) 1101m, the latter used for walking, climbing and ice climbing. Spectacular views. Flora/Fauna in higher regions typical of Arctic/Alpine region. Red Deer, Buzzards, Harriers Golden Eagles - domestic animals - black faced sheep. Deer grass, hardy plantains, heather. Forestry in NW kilometre square providing employment. Road/Rail communications encroach extreme SW linking villages.
